in

June 25, 1992
PHILIP MORRIS STATEMENT
REGARDING UNITED STATES SUPREME COURT
CPPOLLONE DECISION
Yesterday,
the
United States Supreme Cowte
rendered
the
awaited
decision on the Cipollone case_
In spite of the anti-tobacco interests' efforts to make the decision seem like
defeat for our
industry, the fact is that the Couts verdict was
victory for uS
There were three basic issues in this case_
The first and most irportant
referred
to
as the issue of "failure to w+am
revolved around the Guestion of whether cigarette advertising and label wvarnings,
in effect since the 1960s, provided corsumers with & adequate warning of the risk
factors assodated with
smoking &nd health:
On this most
inportant issue, the Court ruled in
our
favor, and exempted
tobacco companies from post-1969 legal claims that consumers
were not
adequately
#arned
second important issue
was
Fhether plaintiffs
can
assert
claims
that
rormal
mainstream cigerette advertising
and promot:on
somehow undermined
the effectiveness of the hezlth warnings
On this issue, the Court 2lso ruled that
post-1969 claims are pree )
The trird issue
referred to 2s intentional misrepresentation
related to the
question of whether tobacco companies engaged in knowing deception by concealing
3
consumers information not generally kown about the risks of
smoking:

pted ,
